lead_paragraph: Arden Realty Inc. said yesterday that it had agreed to buy 50 office and industrial properties from the AEW/LBA Acquisition Company for $614.5 million in cash and securities, increasing its presence in Southern California. The properties contain 5.2 million square feet and are in San Diego, Orange, Los Angeles, Ventura, Riverside and San Bernardino Counties. The shares of Arden, based in Beverly Hills, Calif., fell $1 yesterday, to $29.875. AEW/LBA Acquisition is a joint venture between Layton-Belling & Associates, a real estate investment and management company based in Newport Beach, Calif., and AEW Partners L.P., a Boston-based real estate investment and advisory firm. The purchase will increase Arden's holdings by about 50 percent, to 125 properties and 16.1 million square feet.
